messages.text: Where have you been for the past six days? You didn’t even tell me you were leaving! I’ve been worried sick.
Mom, I’m really sorry. I didn’t mean to worry you. I had to sort out some things for school, but I should’ve told you.
You should have told me! You know how much I worry about you. What exactly were you doing for six days?
I was working on some school projects and assignments, but I fell behind. I needed time to catch up before everything spirals out of control.
And why didn’t you tell me? This is serious. You could have at least communicated.
I understand, and I really regret not keeping you in the loop. But I’ve got a huge pile of work that’s due soon, and it’s kind of overwhelming.
This isn’t good, especially with everything going on. Have you spoken to your teacher about it?
I haven’t yet... I was afraid they'd get mad or think I’m irresponsible.
You have to face it, though. Tell them what's going on. You can’t keep avoiding the problem.
Yeah, you’re right. I need to start talking to my teachers and figure out a way to get things done.
Okay. But don’t forget—you’ve got to apologize to me and keep me updated. If you’re handling this, I want to know.
I promise, Mom. I’ll keep you updated. Thanks for understanding.
I’ll always understand, but you have to take responsibility. Please, don’t leave it until the last minute again.
I won’t. I’m going to fix this.
I’m counting on you. Let me know if you need anything.
I’ve noticed you haven’t submitted any of your assignments yet. Is everything okay?
Hi, Mrs. Anderson. I’m really sorry. I’ve been dealing with some personal stuff, and I fell behind on my work.
I understand things can get overwhelming. But you need to take responsibility for your deadlines. Have you made any progress?
I haven’t submitted anything yet. I’ve got a lot of catching up to do, but I’m planning to start as soon as possible.
You should have let me know sooner. Are you asking for extensions on any of your assignments?
I’m not sure if that’s possible, but I’d really appreciate it if you could help me out with some advice on how to manage everything.
I can help you prioritize and organize your tasks. But you need to be proactive about this.
I promise I will. I’ll start with the practice assignments first and then focus on the main project.
Good. But you should also be aware that you might need to stay after school to complete everything.
I understand. I’m willing to do whatever it takes to catch up.
Alright. Make sure you stay on top of your work. If you need extra help, feel free to reach out.
Thank you so much for understanding. I’ll make sure to keep in touch if I need assistance.
Just remember, this doesn’t happen again. You know better.
It won’t. I’ve learned my lesson.
Good. Stay on track, and we’ll make sure you can finish everything.
Hey! How’s everything going with your projects?
Hey, it's been tough. I’ve been out of the house for a while and now I’m way behind on my assignments.
Oh no, that’s rough! What do you have left to do?
I have a bunch of practice assignments to submit, and my final project is still not done.
That sounds stressful. Have you told your teacher about it?
Not yet. I’m scared they’ll get mad at me. But I need to figure out a way to catch up.
You need to talk to them, man. They’ll respect you more if you’re honest about what’s going on.
Yeah, you’re right. I just feel like I’m already too behind to fix this.
You can still fix it! Start small and tackle one task at a time.
I’ll try. I’m just overwhelmed with everything.
I get it. But don’t wait any longer. Do something today!
Okay, I’ll try. But what about you? How’s your work going?
Same here! I’m barely keeping up, but I’m pushing through.
We’ll get through it, bro. Just hang in there.
Yeah, we got this! Let’s talk again soon and check in on each other.
Definitely. We’ll catch up soon.
Hey! Have you finished your project?
No, I’m way behind. I’ve been dealing with some stuff and didn’t submit anything.
Oh no, that’s not good. Do you need help catching up?
Yeah, I’m definitely behind. But I think I’ll be okay if I focus hard.
You’ll get it done! What do you have left to do?
I still need to submit the practice assignments and finish the final project.
That’s a lot, but it’s possible if you stay focused. Have you spoken to your teacher about it?
Not yet. I’m afraid they’ll be disappointed.
They might be, but they’ll respect your honesty. Just let them know what’s going on.
Yeah, you’re right. I’ll do that.
Good luck! Let me know if you need any help.
Thanks, I’ll definitely reach out if I need it.
You’ve got this, Aisha. Stay strong!
I’ll try! Thanks for the support.
